messages.title: Say no to politics as usual. Vote Green.
messages.content: By voting Green on Thursday 7th May you are putting your support behind a new way of thinking that would see ecological prudence and social and environmental justice at the heart of decision making â€“ in Parliament and at City Hall.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Action to tackle and listen to residents to develop a Community Plan for our area.
Engaging and active initiatives to develop a Community Plan for our area; supporting cooperative childcare - so every child has a good start in life.
Campaigning for rent controls and an end to extortionate letting fees.
Innovative ways against austerity budgets that cut vital local services.
A safer, happier cycle path through lighting and community planting.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Greens across Bristol have a track record of standing up for what matters. In the face of Coalition government cuts, we have fought for Bristol to save the Independent Living Fund enabling people with disabilities to continue to live in their homes, and ensured ACORN's Ethical Lettings Charter became Bristol policy.

housing.content: Campaigning for rent controls and an end to extortionate letting fees.

contactInformation.address: The Bristol Green Party, c/o 17 Cotham Hill, Bristol, BS6 6LD; c/o 73 Chelsea Road, Bristol, BS5 6AU
